DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the concomitant corticosteroid, hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation), administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the concomitant corticosteroid, hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation), administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).(NCI):Given.

Concepts.definition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on maintenance corticosteriods?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving chronic pharmacologic doses of corticosteriods?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received corticosteroids within 4 weeks prior to the diagnostic lumbar puncture?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on steroid medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Systemic therapy with either corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive medications

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on  corticosteroids, has the dose been stable or decreasing for at least 5 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Concurrent or planned concurrent treatment with systemic high dose (immunosuppressive) corticosteroids, or treatment with systemic corticosteroids within 4 weeks of baseline

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently taking Corticosteroid medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has it been greater than or equal to 14 days since the last dose of corticosteroids if it was used to modify immune adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (greater than physiologic replacement, defined as dexamethasone 0.75 mg/m2/day) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on  corticosteroids, has the dose been stable or decreasing for at least 1 week prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient taking a corticosteroid?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient not taking any concomitant systemic steroid medications, or last took them within the indicated period, or is taking only those with exceptions?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Therapy Ind-2 2018279v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
